title: P-Value & Null Hypothesis
text: The problem says to test at a 1% significance level, meaning that the $$p-value$$ threshold is $$0.01$$. If $$p-value$$ < $$0.01$$, reject $$H_0$$. This means that you would be rejecting $$μ_A$$ $$=$$ $$μ_B$$, and the means are different. If $$p-value$$ $$ \geq $$ $$0.01$$, accept $$H_0$$ such that $$μ_A$$ $$=$$ $$μ_B$$, and the means are the same.

title: Testing the Null Hypothesis
text: Is the $$p-value$$ greater or less than $$0.01$$?
speech: Is the , p minus value  greater or less than  0.01 ?

title: Rejecting or Accepting the Null Hypothesis
text: The $$p-value$$ of $$0.1928$$ is greater than $$0.01$$, meaning that it accepts the null hypothesis. At the 1% level of significance, from the sample data, there is not sufficient evidence to conclude that a student who graduates from college A has taken more math classes, on the average, than a student who graduates from college B.
